Freezing Level: Starting close to freezing higher tops, also frost in some corries and glens. Lifting above freezing at all levels.
Above the summits; may lower close to highest slopes later.
Generally above the summits, although some slopes close to freezing point early in day. Frost many glens at dawn.
Terrain frozen from glens upward following very low minima. Only just lifting above zero lower slopes.

column5: -3C, but feeling closer to -16C in direct exposure to strongest winds.
-2C, but feeling closer to -14C at first in direct exposure to strongest winds.
-2C; little change of temperature with height, locally staying close to freezing lower slopes.
0 to 2C. Colder lower slopes below an inversion.
-1C, but very locally a degree or so above freezing.
2 or 3C; will then drop sub-zero into the night.
0 or -1C, but dropping through day to -3C, particularly N Cairngorms. Feeling closer to -16C in direct exposure to strongest winds.

Freezing Level: Close to freezing in some areas from lower slopes upward, but will generally lift above zero from west later.
column5: 0C or just above, with only small change of temperature with height; slowly rising a degree or so from west.

Freezing Level: Air temperatures generally well above freezing on tops, although some terrain at least partly frozen.
column5: 1 or 2C locally if in cloud, but more likely in range 3 to 6C, perhaps warmer toward Deeside.
2 to 4C, but may fall toward 0C by dusk. Feeling closer to -15C in direct exposure to the wind.
-2 or -3C, feeling closer to -20C in direct exposure to winds around dawn; but wind chill soon easing.
Close to 0C at first, lifting to 3C for a few hours, before abruptly lower to -2C later in afternoon.

Freezing Level: Terrain widely frozen following hard overnight frost into glens.
column5: Around -1C, little variation with height. Nearly all glens sub-zero all day. Will then rise a degree or so into night.
1 or 2C, but feeling closer to -10C in direct exposure to the strongest winds.
Around 1C, small change in temperature with height.
1 or 2C, but feeling closer to -10C in direct exposure to the strongest winds.
Around 1C, small change in temperature with height.
-2 to +1C, likely rising gradually from west through day.

Freezing Level: Just above freezing on highest summits.
column5: 2 to 4C; small drop of temperature with greater height.
2C, dropping through day to 0C or just below. Feeling closer to -18C in direct exposure to strongest winds.
3 or 4C at first, soon rising to 6 to 8C.

Freezing Level: Frost in glens from dawn; staying at least part-frozen much of day.
column5: -2C; will begin to rise afternoon, above zero into night.
3 to 5C morning, then dropping toward 0C, or just below by dusk; then -3C overnight.
-4C lifting to around -1C, but feeling closer to -25C in direct exposure to strongest winds in afternoon.
Around -4C, but feeling closer to -22C in direct exposure to strongest winds in morning.
-1 or -2C, but tending to lift during afternoon to around 1C.
3 to 6C, highest in the east, but feeling closer to -15C in direct exposure to strongest winds.
5 to 7C, small variation of temperature with height.

Freezing Level: Terrain frozen with snow cover from most glens upward. Partial daytime thawing only lowest slopes.
column5: -3C. Will rise marginally through the day.
